contact.office_address: Chief Minister's Office, Civil Secretariat, Itanagar, Arunachal Pradesh

history: Arunachal Pradesh Statehood Day is state holiday which observes in every year at 20 February on the occasion of formation of Arunachal Pradesh.

dishes.name: Rice
dishes.description: A staple food, rice is cooked in a hollow bamboo over hot coal, which gives it a different flavor.

dishes.name: Wungwut Ngam
dishes.description: A fried chicken dish made by marinating chicken pieces in rice flour with herbs and spices, then deep-frying them.

dishes.name: Dung Po
dishes.description: A unique style of rice cooked using two brass utensils and wrapped in leaves before serving.

dishes.name: Gyapa Khazi
dishes.description: A fermented fish dish made by combining fish with a special blend of spices and herbs.

dishes.name: Koat Pitha
dishes.description: A deep-fried dessert made of bananas, mustard oil, and jaggery.

dishes.name: Kharzi
dishes.description: A tasty dish from the monpa tribes, which use fermented cheese in their cooking.

dishes.name: Oying vegetable stew
dishes.description: A traditional dish of the Adi tribe that's easy to make at home and doesn't use any oil.

dishes.name: Poora Haah
dishes.description: A traditional dish made with dried meat, typically from wild ducks (haah), and bamboo shoots.

tourist_places.name: Namdapha National Park & Tiger Reserve
tourist_places.history: Namdapha National Park & Tiger Reserve is a 1,234-square-mile rainforest reserve known for its rich biodiversity, including tigers, leopards, and ancient trees. It offers activities such as wildlife and landscape photography, jungle camping, and boat rides.

tourist_places.name: Pakke Tiger Reserve
tourist_places.history: Pakke Tiger Reserve is an 862-square-kilometer wildlife sanctuary famous for hornbill watching, tigers, and elephants. It is located in the Seijosa area.

tourist_places.name: Tawang Monastery
tourist_places.history: Tawang Monastery, also known as Galden Namgey Lhatse, is a 17th-century Buddhist monastery located in the Tawang town of Arunachal Pradesh. It is one of the largest and oldest monasteries in Asia, housing a museum, prayer hall, and offering stunning natural beauty.

tourist_places.name: GOLDEN PAGODA
tourist_places.history: The GOLDEN PAGODA, also known as Kongmu Kham, is a Thai/Burmese-style Buddhist pagoda located in Namsai, Arunachal Pradesh. It features a golden roof and landscaped gardens, with an impressive elevated location and excellent architecture.

tourist_places.name: Ita Fort
tourist_places.history: Ita Fort is a centuries-old brick fortress located in Itanagar, Arunachal Pradesh. It offers views of the mountains and is considered a good place for kids, with scenic beauty.
